questions.question_text: Within the asset audit form, where would you find the list of all assets that are currently assigned to the stockroom or warehouse that is being audited?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

B - expected assets

Source: Expected Assets: Shows all assets that are assigned to the stockroom or location that is being audited. The list isnâ€™t populated until scanning begins.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-asset-management/page/product/hardware-asset-management/reference/audit-results.html

choices.B: The software allocations are handled based upon the configuration of the system property glide.ham.retire_sw()
choices.D: The software allocations are automatically returned back into inventory
choices.C: The software allocations are removed from the asset but not returned to inventory
choices.A: The software allocations remain with the hardware asset and need to be reclaimed manually

questions.question_text: When a hardware asset is retired what happens to any existing software allocations on that asset?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A

Selected Answer: A
Majority of searches on the internet searches point to A, so I will go with A. Also surprised no one is considering B as the property configuration determines the actual reclamation via option B "system property glide.ham.retire_sw()"
Answer is A. I specifically remember this exact sentence from my studying
should be D. Manual actions only happens in Pre-Ham. With HAM, this is done automatically by the Asset task.

Selected Answer: C
If you use the offboard request then only steps are there which ensures removal of allocations and returning to inventory, it doesn't happen automatically.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A
ADF - As per ServiceNow online course

Selected Answer: AF
Question misleading - only 2 valid options A and F

confirmed via docs today: 
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-asset-management/page/product/hardware-asset-management/reference/hardware-model-fields.html
(Vancouver is the same as Washington)

Selected Answer: ADF
Hardware Model Lifecycles for Vancouver are
Pre-Release
General Availability
End of Sale
End of Support
End of Extended Support
End of Life

comments.content:
Pre-release is also a lifecycle phase.
Hardware has been purchased, Plans are in progress for releasing for general availability.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AF
This question is incorrect/misleading. There are only two(2) valid ones on the list. A and F

Valid lifecycle phases are: 

General Availability
End of Sale
End of Support
End of Extended Support
End of Life
